Key Match Events: The Men's T20 World Cup match between Ireland and Afghanistan was abandoned without a ball being bowled because of rain at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland captain Andrew Balbirnie said, 'It's very disappointing, we'd played good cricket and were looking forward to this but can't do much about the weather.'
Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi said, 'Most of the players are disappointed, not having played on such a fantastic ground [the MCG], but the weather is not in our control, so we have to accept it.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Both sides are awarded a point, leaving Ireland third in Group 1, while Afghanistan remain bottom.
England's match with Australia was also washed out later in the day.
Ireland next face holders and hosts Australia in Brisbane on Monday.
Afghanistan's next tie is also in Brisbane, against Sri Lanka on Tuesday.
Others: The rain forced a no-result between Afghanistan and Ireland, leaving both teams with a point each.
